Package views

Class AdventureGameView

java.lang.Object
views.AdventureGameView
public class AdventureGameView extends Object
This is the Class that will visualize the model.

    • updateScene

      public void updateScene(String textToDisplay)
      Show the current room, and print some text below it. If the input parameter is not null, it will be displayed below the image. Otherwise, the current room description will be displayed below the image.
      Parameters:
      textToDisplay - the text to display below the image.

    • updateItems

      public void updateItems()
      This method is partially completed, but you are asked to finish it off. The method should populate the objectsInRoom and objectsInInventory Vboxes. Each Vbox should contain a collection of nodes (Buttons, ImageViews, you can decide) Each node represents a different object. Images of each object are in the assets folders of the given adventure game.

    • showInstructions

      public void showInstructions()
      Show the game instructions. If helpToggle is FALSE: -- display the help text in the CENTRE of the gridPane (i.e. within cell 1,1) -- use whatever GUI elements to get the job done! -- set the helpToggle to TRUE -- REMOVE whatever nodes are within the cell beforehand! If helpToggle is TRUE: -- redraw the room image in the CENTRE of the gridPane (i.e. within cell 1,1) -- set the helpToggle to FALSE -- Again, REMOVE whatever nodes are within the cell beforehand!

    • updateTrollScene

      public void updateTrollScene()
      This method is called when the player encounters a troll. It will display the troll game in the GUI.

    • updateNPCScene

      public void updateNPCScene()
      This method is called when the player encounters an NPC. It will display the NPC game in the GUI.

    • trollObserver

      public void trollObserver(Troll troll)
      This method handles the event related to the troll button.
      Parameters:
      troll - the troll object to be passed to the troll game

      This method articulates Room Descriptions
      Parameters:
      longDescription - whether to play the long description audio or not

    • articulateRoomDescription

      public void articulateRoomDescription()
      This overload articulates long Room Descriptions if the current room has not been visited and short Room Descriptions if it has.

    • stopArticulation

      public void stopArticulation()
      This method stops articulations (useful when transitioning to a new room or loading a new game)
